page.title: 04Hamble river
page.content:
to the public.Before the second World War the the hard and foreshore was just mud & marsh right up to the road, but during the War the American forces reclaimed what is now the hard and used it to repair their patron landing craft. Today the foreshore is fronted by a carpark and a stony area with benches were people can sit and watch the busy activity of the river .At the entrance of the carpark a poster warns of rabies,a precution which must be taken in all ports and seafronts areas.
Visitors can sit on the hard ,and watch the boats,going up and down the river. The dinghies stored in the foreshore pound balong mostly to Hamble river Sailing Club members but still permission must be obtained
